## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

epi2020 <- readRDS('data/epi_2020.rds')
epi2021 <- readRDS('data/epi_2021.rds')
sisver.ayer <- readRDS(paste('data/epi_', format(Sys.Date() - 1, '%d%m%y'), '.rds', sep = ''))
sisver.ayer <- rbind(epi2020, epi2021, sisver.ayer)
sisver.hoy <- readRDS(paste('data/epi_', format(Sys.Date(), '%d%m%y'), '.rds', sep = ''))
sisver.hoy <- rbind(epi2020, epi2021, sisver.hoy)

sisver.hoy %>%
  filter(ENTRESI == 'SONORA', 
         !FOLIO.SINAVE %in% sisver.ayer$FOLIO.SINAVE) %>%
  mutate(semana = )
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
